Sample Final Examination Feb 2024

Part B

Question 1 (Chapter 2: Promissory Note & Bank Discount)

r = 10%
d = 9%
Proceed, P = RM14,358.17
Date of the note = 11 January 2022
discount term = 30 days

a)

\[ \begin{align} Proceed &= S(1 - dt) \\ 14,358.17 &= S(1 - 0.09(\frac{30}{360})) \\ S &= RM14,466.67 \end{align} \]

Note

We use proceeds formula to determine the value pf S (maturity value) since the proceed value was given. In addition, the discount term is 30 days since it is stated that the note was discounted 30 days before the maturity date.

b)

\[ \begin{align} D &= S - Proceeds \\ &= 14,466.67 - 14,358.17 \\ &= RM108.50 \end{align} \]

Question 2 (Chapter 3: Compound Interest)

P = RM4,000
k = 6%
m = 2 (compounded semi-annually)
t = 3 years

Add a a saving of RM5,000 after two years from the initial deposit

Solution 1
\[ \begin{align} S_1 &= P(1 + i)^n \\ &= 4,000\bigg(1 + \frac{0.06}{2}\bigg)^4 \\ &= RM4,502.04 \\ \\ Add\ another\ RM5,000 \\ New\ P &= 4,502.04 + 5,000 \\ &= RM9,502.04 \\ \\ S &= New\ P(1 + i)^n \\ &= 9,502.04\bigg(1 + \frac{0.06}{2}\bigg)^2 \\ &= RM10,080.71 \end{align} \] Solution 2
\[ \begin{align} S &= (P(1 + i)^{n_1} + 5,000)(1 + i)^{n_2}\\ &= \bigg(4,000\bigg(1 + \frac{0.06}{2}\bigg)^4 + 5,000\bigg)\bigg(1 + \frac{0.06}{2}\bigg)^2 \\ &= RM10,080.71 \end{align} \]

Question 3 (Chapter 4: Annuity)

DP = RM35,000
t = 25 years
m = 12 (monthly)
R = RM1,580
k = 4.9%
n = 12(25) = 300

a)
\[ \begin{align} A &= R\bigg[\frac{1 - (1 + i)^{-n}}{i}\bigg]\\ &= 1,580\bigg[\frac{1 - \bigg(1 + \bigg(\frac{0.049}{12}\bigg)\bigg)^{-300}}{\bigg(\frac{0.049}{12}\bigg)}\bigg]\\ &= RM272,988.66\\ \\ CP &= A + DP\\ &= 272,988.66 + 35,000\\ &= RM307,988.66 \end{align} \] b)
\[ \begin{align} n = 6 \\ S &= R\bigg[\frac{(1 + i)^{n}-1}{i}\bigg]\\ &= 1,580\bigg[\frac{\bigg(1 + \bigg(\frac{0.049}{12}\bigg)\bigg)^{6}-1}{\bigg(\frac{0.049}{12}\bigg)}\bigg]\\ &= RM9,577.30 \end{align} \]

Question 4 (Chapter 5: Trade and Cash Discount)

n = 15 units
Invoice date = 11 Nov. 2020
Invoice = RM52,800 (Include Transportation = RM300)
LP = 52,800 - 300 = RM52,500
r_1 = 12%
r_2 = 10%
cash term = 9/10, 7/20, n/30

a)
\[ \begin{align} SDER &= 1 - (1-r_1)(1-r_2)\\ &= 1 - (1-0.12)(1-0.1)\\ &= 1 - (0.88)(0.9)\\ &= 0.208\ @\ 20.8\% \end{align} \] b)
7/20 - 20 days after the invoice date 11 November 2020

11 Nov - 30 Nov = 19 days
Hence, last date to received 7% cash discount is on 1 December 2020

c)
Payment on 21 November 2020 (10 days from date of invoice)
Received 9% cash discount

\[ \begin{align} Total\ Payment\ &= L(1-SDER)(1-cd)\ + Transport\\ &= 52,500(1-0.208)(1-0.09) + 300\\ &= RM38,137.80 \end{align} \]

Question 5 (Chapter 6: Markup & Markdown)

n = 200
TC = RM1,600 –> C = \(\frac{TC}{n} = RM8\)
NP = 30% on Selling Price –> NP = 0.3R
OE = 12% on Cost –> OE = 0.12C

  1. \[ \begin{align} R &= C + OE + NP\\ R &= C + 0.12C + 0.3R\\ R - 0.3R &= 1.12C\\ R &= \frac{1.12C}{0.7}\\ &= \frac{1.12(8)}{0.7}\\ &= RM12.80 \end{align} \] b)

\[ \begin{align} BEP &= C + OE\\ &= 1.2(8)\\ &= RM8.96\\ \\ Max\ MD\% &= \frac{R-BEP}{R}\times100\%\\ &= \frac{12.80 - 8.96}{12.8}\times100\%\\ &= 30\%\\ \\ or,\ Max\ MD\% &= \frac{NP}{R}\times100\%\\ \end{align} \]

Note

The maximum percentage of markdown is equivalent to the NP% if the net profit is base on the selling price.

Question 6 (Chapter 7: Installment Purchase)

CP = RM3,000
DP = 0
n = 40 (weekly)
m = 52
r = 13% (original balance)

a)
\[ \begin{align} I &= Brt\\ &= 3,000\ \times\ 0.13\ \times\ \frac{40}{52}\\ &= RM300 \end{align} \] b)
\[ \begin{align} R &= \frac{B+I}{n}\\ &= \frac{3,000 + 300}{40}\\ &= RM82.50 \end{align} \] c)
\[ \begin{align} N &= 40-30 = 10\\ n &= 40\\ \\ Outstanding\ Balance\ ,\ B &= RN-I\bigg[\frac{N(N+1)}{n(n+1)}\bigg]\\ &= 3,000(10)-300\bigg[\frac{10(10+1)}{40(40+1)}\bigg]\\ &= RM804.88 \end{align} \]

Question 7 (Chapter 8: Depreciation)

C = RM12,500
n = 8 years
S = RM4,700
method = declining balance

\[ \begin{align} r &= 1 - \sqrt[n]\frac{S}{C}\\ &= 1 - \sqrt[8]\frac{4,700}{12,500}\\ &= 0.1151\ @\ 11.51\%\\ \\ BV_4 &= C(1-r)^4\\ &= 12,500(1 - 0.1151)^4\\ &= RM7,664.85 \end{align} \]
